medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced abdominal pain for 4 days, which began suddenly after eating a roast beef sandwich and pizza following a golf outing. The pain was described as 'like someone was punching him in the stomach,' unrelenting and worsening over time. The patient also reported nausea and one episode of non-bloody emesis, with poor appetite and no bowel movements since the onset of pain. Pain relief attempts with ibuprofen, acetaminophen, and oxycontin provided incomplete relief. There was a previous episode of right chest/RUQ discomfort that resolved spontaneously one month prior.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes Mellitus, Chronic Respiratory Insufficiency, Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease, AAA (5.8cm) status post endovascular repair, Hypertension, Hyperlipidemia, Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia, Diverticulosis, Colon polyps (adenomas).
medical_history.family_history: No family history of liver or pancreatic disease, no colon cancer.
